alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 2:01PM MST until August 12 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR GILA AND COCONINO COUNTIES ALONG AND JUST NORTH OF THE MOGOLLON RIM... At 157 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain has moved away from the warned area, along and just north of the Mogollon Rim including the Clear Creek drainage. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain fell earlier this afternoon. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Baker Butte Lookout and Kehl Springs Campground. This includes State Route 87 between mile markers 281 and 287. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Toms Creek, Clover Creek, West Webber Creek, Corduroy Wash and Clear Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
